author: TNN
title: Dense Fog: Dense Fog Alert: Odisha Districts Brace for Extended Period of Low Visibility | Bhubaneswar News - Times of India
text: Bhubaneswar: IMD forecast on Thursday said dense fog would be very likely to continue in several districts during the next two to three days amid a slight rise trend in minimum temperature. The districts likely to witness this include Puri, Khurda, Nayagarh, Ganjam, Gajapati, Cuttack, Jagatsinghpur, among others. The office of Special Relief Commissioner (SRC) in the wake of IMD's warning sent its routine advisory to district collectors to take needful steps for restricted driving in their respective areas during morning hours. \"Police and transport officials of respective districts may take necessary steps for controlled plying of vehicles on highways during dense fog to avoid any road accident,\" reads the advisory from SRC office. H R Biswas, the regional head of IMD centre in the city said, “Prevailing wind pattern and availability of moisture favour for continue of shallow to moderate or dense fog in the state this week.” He said minimum temperature saw a rise by two to three degrees Celsius at several places in the state and there would be no large change in the prevailing trend of mercury level during the next three-four days. Dense fog reducing visibility to 50 meter or less was reported from towns like Rourkela, Cuttack, Phulbani, Nayagarh and Koraput.We also published the following articles recentlyIMD issues red warning for very dense fog todayThe weather department has issued a red alert for very dense fog in Delhi-NCR on Friday. Experts warn against venturing out in vehicles between 4 am and 10 am due to the high risk of car pile-ups and accidents. Overnight winds on Thursday improved visibility, but Friday is expected to have very low visibility due to decreased wind speed. The air quality in Delhi remains very poor, and the AQI is likely to stay in the very poor range until Sunday. Noida and Ghaziabad also experience improved but still very poor air quality.106362105Brace for dense to very dense fog in Lucknow todayLucknow experiences first 'cold day' of winter as maximum temperature drops, breaking warm spell. Thick fog persists, reducing visibility and obstructing sun rays. Temperature remains below normal, with a weak western disturbance changing wind pattern and causing moisture incursion. Fresh western disturbance expected to bring snow in Jammu & Kashmir and increase wind velocity. Partly cloudy sky and light rainfall predicted in UP, leading to a decline in fog density.106362725Dense fog envelopes parts of North India, reduces visibilityThe winter chill continues to grip North India, with cities like Kanpur and Aligarh experiencing dense fog. Locals gather around bonfires for warmth as the mercury drops even lower. Visibility in several parts of Delhi drops to 125 meters, while the air quality remains 'very poor'. Non-essential construction work has been banned in the Delhi-NCR.106267801
